item.title: Immigrants with no criminal convictions represent sharpest growth in ICE detention population
item.description: The number of people in ICE detention without criminal convictions nearly doubled in the last month — a significant increase compared to detainees who have been convicted of crimes.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: He didn't write the tax and spending bill, but it shares his vision for government
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with McKay Coppins, who recently profiled Russell Vought in the Atlantic. Vought is a key player in the Trump administration's push to remake the federal government.

item.title: Supreme Court to decide if states can ban transgender girls in sports
item.description: The Supreme Court has agreed to hear two cases in the fall that test state laws banning transgender women and girls from participating in sports at publicly funded institutions.

item.title: U.K. High Court slams MI5 over informant deception and lack of transparency
item.description: A ruling by London's High Court cited the domestic intelligence agency's failure to explain why representatives had repeatedly misled U.K. courts about an informant accused of violence against women.

item.title: China Works to Dominate in AI and EV
item.description: The reality of China's efforts to lead in two important tech sectors. In artificial intelligence, control of the data needed to train new models could dictate where the industry is able to expand fastest. And a price war in China's electric vehicle industry.

item.title: Abrego Garcia says he was severely beaten in Salvadoran prison
item.description: Kilmar Abrego Garcia, who was mistakenly deported from the U.S. in March, says he was brutally beaten and subjected to psychological torture while held in one of El Salvador's most notorious prisons.

item.title: Pope Leo's scandal-plagued hometown sees a bright future in buying his childhood home
item.description: Pope Leo grew up in a small brick house in the Chicago suburb of Dolton which is now up for auction. The village's board of trustees voted to buy it, in the hopes of creating a historic attraction.
